required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Elbasvir/Grazoprevir (EBR/GZR) and Sofosbuvir (SOF) With and Without Ribavirin (RBV) in Cirrhotic Subjects With Chronic Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Genotype 3 (GT3) Infection (MK-5172-083)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Randomized, Open-Label Clinical Trial to Study the Efficacy and Safety of the Combination Regimen of Elbasvir/Grazoprevir (EBR/GZR) and Sofosbuvir (SOF) With and Without Ribavirin (RBV) in Cirrhotic Subjects With Chronic HCV GT3 Infection

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, multi-site, open-label trial of the co-administration of a fixed-dose combination (FDC) of EBR 50 mg + GZR (100 mg) (EBR/GZR) and SOF 400 mg, with and without RBV, in treatment-naïve (TN) and treatment-experienced (TE) participants with chronic HCV GT3 infection with compensated cirrhosis.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving SVR12 (Sustained Virologic Response 12 Weeks After the End of All Study Therapy)
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants achieving SVR12 (i.e., HCV ribnonucleic acid [RNA] < Lower Limit of Quantification [LLOQ] 12 weeks after completing study treatment) was determined. Plasma HCV RNA levels were determined with the COBAS™ AmpliPrep/COBAS™ Taqman™ HCV Test, v2.0 ® assay, which has a LLOQ of 15 IU/mL.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing an Adverse Event (AE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 18 weeks (up to 2 weeks after completion of study treatment)
primary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with this treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Discontinuing From Study Therapy Due to an AE
primary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with this treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving SVR24 (Sustained Virologic Response 24 Weeks After the End of All Study Therapy)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants achieving SVR24 (i.e., HCV RNA < LLOQ 24 weeks after completing study treatment) was determined. Plasma HCV RNA levels were determined with the COBAS™ AmpliPrep/COBAS™ Taqman™ HCV Test, v2.0 ® assay, which has a LLOQ of 15 IU/mL.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm 1: HCV GT3 TN EBG/GZR+SOF+RBV 8 Weeks
arm_group.description: TN HCV GT3 participants will take 1 fixed-dose combination (FDC) tablet containing EBR 50 mg+GZR 100 mg and 1 tablet containing SOF 400 mg once-daily (q.d.) with RBV (200 mg capsules; weight-based dosing) twice-daily (b.i.d.) for 8 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm 2: HCV GT3 TN EBG/GZR+SOF 12 Weeks
arm_group.description: TN HCV GT3 participants will take 1 FDC tablet containing EBR 50 mg+GZR 100 mg and 1 tablet containing SOF 400 mg q.d. for 12 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm 3: HCV GT3 TE EBG/GZR+SOF 12 Weeks
arm_group.description: TE HCV GT3 participants will take 1 FDC tablet containing EBR 50 mg+GZR 100 mg and 1 tablet containing SOF 400 mg q.d. for 12 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm 4: HCV GT3 TE EBG/GZR+SOF+RBV 12 Weeks
arm_group.description: TE HCV GT3 participants will take 1 FDC tablet containing EBR 50 mg+GZR 100 mg and 1 tablet containing SOF 400 mg q.d. with RBV (200 mg capsules; weight-based dosing) b.i.d. for 12 weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm 5: HCV GT3 TE EBG/GZR+SOF 16 Weeks
arm_group.description: TE HCV GT3 participants will take 1 FDC tablet containing EBR 50 mg+GZR 100 mg and 1 tablet containing SOF 400 mg q.d. for 16 weeks.

intervention.description: GZR 100 mg is a component of the MK-5172A FDC tablet (also containing EBR 50 mg) and was taken q.d. by mouth in the morning.
intervention.arm_group_label: Arm 1: HCV GT3 TN EBG/GZR+SOF+RBV 8 Weeks
Arm 2: HCV GT3 TN EBG/GZR+SOF 12 Weeks
Arm 3: HCV GT3 TE EBG/GZR+SOF 12 Weeks
Arm 4: HCV GT3 TE EBG/GZR+SOF+RBV 12 Weeks
Arm 5: HCV GT3 TE EBG/GZR+SOF 16 Weeks

intervention.description: EBR 50 mg is a component of the MK-5172A FDC tablet (also containing GZR 100 mg) and was taken q.d. by mouth in the morning.
intervention.arm_group_label: Arm 1: HCV GT3 TN EBG/GZR+SOF+RBV 8 Weeks
Arm 2: HCV GT3 TN EBG/GZR+SOF 12 Weeks
Arm 3: HCV GT3 TE EBG/GZR+SOF 12 Weeks
Arm 4: HCV GT3 TE EBG/GZR+SOF+RBV 12 Weeks
Arm 5: HCV GT3 TE EBG/GZR+SOF 16 Weeks

intervention.description: RBV 200 mg capsules taken b.i.d. (morning and evening) by mouth at a total daily dose ranging from 800 mg to 1400 mg (total daily dose was based on participant body weight).
intervention.arm_group_label: Arm 1: HCV GT3 TN EBG/GZR+SOF+RBV 8 Weeks
Arm 4: HCV GT3 TE EBG/GZR+SOF+RBV 12 Weeks

intervention.description: SOF 400 mg tablet taken q.d. by mouth in the morning with food.
intervention.arm_group_label: Arm 1: HCV GT3 TN EBG/GZR+SOF+RBV 8 Weeks
Arm 2: HCV GT3 TN EBG/GZR+SOF 12 Weeks
Arm 3: HCV GT3 TE EBG/GZR+SOF 12 Weeks
Arm 4: HCV GT3 TE EBG/GZR+SOF+RBV 12 Weeks
Arm 5: HCV GT3 TE EBG/GZR+SOF 16 Weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- has HCV RNA (>= 10,000 IU/mL in peripheral blood) at screening
- has documented HCV GT3 (with no evidence of non-typeable or mixed GT infection)
- has compensated cirrhosis of the liver
- has liver imaging within 6 months of Day 1 with no evidence of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC)
- is either HCV TN or TE (i.e., has documented prior virologic failure or intolerance to peg-interferon/ribavirin)
- is otherwise healthy as determined by medical history, physical examination, electrocardiogram (ECG), and clinical laboratory measurements
- has compensated cirrhosis of the liver
- is TN or TE (i.e., documented prior virologic failure or intolerance to peg-interferon/ribavirin)
- is not of reproductive potential, or agrees to not impregnate a partner or become pregnant for at least 2 weeks prior to the first dose of study drug, and for 7 months after the final dose of study drug (or longer if dictated by local regulations)
Exclusion Criteria:
- has previously received one or more doses of a direct-acting antiviral (DAA)
- has evidence of decompensated liver disease
- is coinfected with hepatitis B (hepatitis B surface antigen [HBsAg] positive)
- has a recent (within 5 years) history of malignancy or is under evaluation for HCC or other suspected malignancy
- is currently or has participated (within past 30 days) in a study with an investigational compound
- has clinically-relevant drug or alcohol abuse within the past 12 months of screening
- is a female and is pregnant or breast-feeding
- is a male whose female partner is/are pregnant
- has any of the following:
- organ transplants
- poor venous access
- history of gastric surgery or malabsorption disorder
- current or history of clinically significant cardiac abnormalities or dysfunction
- chronic pulmonary disease
- hemoglobinopathy
- history of hospitalization within 3 months prior to enrollment
- medical or surgical condition that may result in need for hospitalization during the course of the study
- any condition requiring, or likely to require, chronic systemic administration of corticosteroids, tumor necrosis factor (TNF) antagonists, or other immunosuppresant drugs during the course of the study
- any condition, prestudy laboratory or ECG abnormality, or history of any illness, which could confound results of the study or pose additional risks in administering study drugs in the opinion of the investigator
- has a life-threatening serious AE (SAE) during the screening period
- has evidence of history of chronic hepatitis not caused by HCV

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Adult participants infected with HCV GT3 were enrolled at 14 study centers in the United Kingdom.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 101 participants were randomized, including 1 participant who did not meet inclusion criteria and who should have been considered a screen failure; this participant was not treated with study drug. A total of 100 participants were treated.

group.title: Arm 1: HCV GT3 TN EBG/GZR+SOF+RBV 8 Weeks
group.description: Treatment-naïve (TN) Hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype 3 (GT3) participants took 1 fixed-dose combination (FDC) tablet containing elbasvir (EBR) 50 mg + grazoprevir (GZR) 100 mg and 1 tablet containing sofosbuvir (SOF) 400 mg once daily (q.d.) with ribavirin (RBV) (200 mg capsules; weight-based dosing) twice daily (b.i.d.) for 8 weeks.

group.title: Arm 2: HCV GT3 TN EBG/GZR+SOF 12 Weeks
group.description: TN HCV GT3 participants took 1 FDC tablet containing EBR 50 mg + GZR 100 mg and 1 tablet containing SOF 400 mg q.d. for 12 weeks.

group.title: Arm 3: HCV GT3 TE EBG/GZR+SOF 12 Weeks
group.description: Treatment-experienced (TE) HCV GT3 participants took 1 FDC tablet containing EBR 50 mg + GZR 100 mg and 1 tablet containing SOF 400 mg q.d. for 12 weeks.

group.title: Arm 4: HCV GT3 TE EBG/GZR+SOF+RBV 12 Weeks
group.description: TE HCV GT3 participants took 1 FDC tablet containing EBR 50 mg + GZR 100 mg and 1 tablet containing SOF 400 mg q.d. with RBV (200 mg capsules; weight-based dosing) b.i.d. for 12 weeks.

group.title: Arm 5: HCV GT3 TE EBG/GZR+SOF 16 Weeks
group.description: TE HCV GT3 participants took 1 FDC tablet containing EBR 50 mg+GZR 100 mg and 1 tablet containing SOF 400 mg q.d. for 16 weeks.

baseline.population: The Baseline Analysis population includes only the 100 participants who were both randomized and treated.

group.description: TE HCV GT3 participants took 1 FDC tablet containing EBR 50 mg + GZR 100 mg and 1 tablet containing SOF 400 mg q.d. with RBV (200 mg capsules; weight-based dosing) b.i.d. for 12 weeks.

group.description: TE HCV GT3 participants took 1 FDC tablet containing EBR 50 mg+GZR 100 mg and 1 tablet containing SOF 400 mg q.d. for 16 weeks.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving SVR12 (Sustained Virologic Response 12 Weeks After the End of All Study Therapy)
outcome.description: The percentage of participants achieving SVR12 (i.e., HCV ribnonucleic acid [RNA] < Lower Limit of Quantification [LLOQ] 12 weeks after completing study treatment) was determined. Plasma HCV RNA levels were determined with the COBAS™ AmpliPrep/COBAS™ Taqman™ HCV Test, v2.0 ® assay, which has a LLOQ of 15 IU/mL.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug, were not lost to follow-up for reasons unrelated to study treatment, and had SVR12 data available are included.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts or presentations regarding this trial 45 days prior to submission for publication/presentation.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
